kuusisto.tinysound.internal

Class StreamSound

  • java.lang.Object
    • kuusisto.tinysound.internal.StreamSound
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sound

    public class StreamSound
extends Object
implements Sound
    Thes StreamSound class is an implementation of the Sound interface that streams audio data from a temporary file to reduce memory overhead.
    Author:
    Finn Kuusisto

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StreamSound(URL dataURL, long numBytesPerChannel, Mixer mixer, int id)
      Construct a new StreamSound with the given data and Mixer which will handle this StreamSound.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void play()
      Plays this StreamSound.
      void play(double volume)
      Plays this StreamSound with a specified volume.
      void play(double volume, double pan)
      Plays this MemSound with a specified volume and pan.
      void stop()
      Stops this StreamSound from playing.
      void unload()
      Unloads this StreamSound from the system.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StreamSound

        public StreamSound(URL dataURL,
           long numBytesPerChannel,
           Mixer mixer,
           int id)
            throws IOException
        Construct a new StreamSound with the given data and Mixer which will handle this StreamSound.
        Parameters:
        dataURL - URL of the temporary file containing audio data
        numBytesPerChannel - the total number of bytes for each channel in the file
        mixer - Mixer that will handle this StreamSound
        id - unique ID of this StreamSound
        Throws:
        IOException - if a stream cannot be opened from the URL

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays this StreamSound.
        Specified by:
        play in interface Sound

      • play

        public void play(double volume)
        Plays this StreamSound with a specified volume.
        Specified by:
        play in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        volume - the volume at which to play this StreamSound

      • play

        public void play(double volume,
        double pan)
        Plays this MemSound with a specified volume and pan.
        Specified by:
        play in interface Sound
        Parameters:
        volume - the volume at which to play this MemSound
        pan - the pan value to play this MemSound [-1.0,1.0], values outside the valid range will assume no panning (0.0)

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops this StreamSound from playing. Note that if this StreamSound was played repeatedly in an overlapping fashion, all instances of this StreamSound still playing will be stopped.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Sound

      • unload

        public void unload()
        Unloads this StreamSound from the system. Attempts to use this StreamSound after unloading will result in error.
        Specified by:
        unload in interface Sound
